intro: Rhabdotheca divaricata, commonly known as the variable sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually blue to violet in color, and it produces small, cylindrical fruits. Rhabdotheca divaricata is often found in rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in coastal gardens.
